explanation: The bug was that the code used min(d_list) to pick the discount/value from the list, but the intended logic requires selecting the largest value from d_list. Using min picks the smallest element and produces incorrect results. I fixed that single line by replacing min(d_list) with max(d_list) so the code uses the maximum value from the list.
fixed_code:
n, p, q = map(int,input().split())
d_list = [int(e) for e in input().split()]

a = max(d_list)

print(min(p-q+a,p))
